Class GuiController

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.ui.GuiController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class GuiController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Controller class managing high-level UI interaction, state, and delegating rendering responsibilities to dedicated view components (GameBoardView, NextPieceView). Design Patterns Used: - Observer Pattern: Uses GameSettings singleton to react to setting changes - MVC Pattern: Acts as controller between model (game logic) and view (UI)

      public GuiController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
      Initializes the GuiController after FXML loading. Sets up game settings, audio manager, font, input handling, and danger line.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      location - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
      resources - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.

    • initGameView

      public void initGameView(int[][] boardMatrix, ViewData brick)
      Called by the game logic to fully initialize the view for a new game. Sets up view components, piece containers, and starts the game timeline.
      Parameters:
      boardMatrix - The initial state of the game board.
      brick - The initial ViewData for the first falling brick.

    • updateGameSpeed

      public void updateGameSpeed(int newSpeed)
      Updates the game speed and restarts the game timeline if necessary.
      Parameters:
      newSpeed - The new interval in milliseconds for brick movement.

    • refreshGameBackground

      public void refreshGameBackground(int[][] board)
      Refreshes the visual background of the game board with the latest state of landed blocks.
      Parameters:
      board - The 2D integer array representing the game board's current state.

    • setEventListener

      public void setEventListener(InputEventListener eventListener)
      Sets the input event listener for this controller.
      Parameters:
      eventListener - The InputEventListener to be set.

    • bindScore

      public void bindScore(javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty scoreProp)
      Binds a score property from the game logic to the UI's score label.
      Parameters:
      scoreProp - The IntegerProperty representing the current score.

    • bindHighScore

      public void bindHighScore(javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty highProp)
      Binds a high score property from the game logic to the UI's high score label.
      Parameters:
      highProp - The IntegerProperty representing the high score.

    • bindLevel

      public void bindLevel(javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty levelProp)
      Binds a level property from the game logic to the UI's level label.
      Parameters:
      levelProp - The IntegerProperty representing the current level.

    • gameOver

      public void gameOver()
      Handles the game over state. Stops game timelines, records player statistics, displays the game over panel, and updates game state flags.

    • recordCombo

      public void recordCombo(int linesCleared)
      Records a combo event when multiple lines are cleared simultaneously.
      Parameters:
      linesCleared - The number of lines cleared in the combo.

    • setPrimaryStage

      public void setPrimaryStage(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Sets the primary stage of the application.
      Parameters:
      stage - The primary Stage object.

    • requestGameFocus

      public void requestGameFocus()
      Requests keyboard focus for the game panel to ensure input events are captured.

    • newGame

      public void newGame(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Initiates a new game. Stops existing timelines, hides game over panel, triggers model reset, and restarts game timelines.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The ActionEvent that triggered this method (can be null if called programmatically).

    • pauseGame

      public void pauseGame(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Toggles the pause state of the game. Pauses/resumes game timelines and music, and updates UI elements accordingly.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The ActionEvent that triggered this method.
